metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13099 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
wolfSSL prior to version 3.12.2 provides a weak Bleichenbacher oracle whenany TLS cipher suite using RSA key exchange is negotiated. An attacker canrecover the private key from a vulnerable wolfSSL application. Thisvulnerability is referred to as "ROBOT."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 3.13.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0+dfsg-1').
